alert.note: Alert for Southwestern St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 2:01PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern St. Tammany Parish through 315 PM CDT... At 200 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lacombe, or 13 miles west of Slidell, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Covington, Abita Springs and Lacombe. This includes Interstate 12 between mile markers 60 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
